channel.title: Apps on Simo Ahava's blog
channel.description: Recent content in Apps on Simo Ahava's blog

item.title: Google Analytics For Mobile Apps Getting Shut Down
item.description:
If you’re a user of the free version of Google Analytics, and if you have a free Google Analytics property collecting hits exclusively from the Google Analytics Services SDK (Android or iOS), you might have recently received an email that looks like this (emphasis mine):

In a nutshell, Google is now starting the process of deprecating the “legacy” Google Analytics for Mobile Apps. This covers all data collection SDKs that do not have the word “Firebase” in them. As such, also the “Google Analytics” tags in Google Tag Manager for mobile apps will be impacted.

item.title: Setup Google Tag Manager iOS With Swift
item.description:
I’ve been meaning to write about Google Tag Manager for mobile apps for such a long time. Finally, I have some great use cases to share, as well as some useful examples for implementing GTM for iOS. That’s right, this is an iOS guide, and, to be more specific, geared towards a successful Swift implementation.

If you didn’t know, Swift is a relatively new programming language, developed by Apple for iOS and OS X programming. It’s got some nice synergies with existing Objective-C implementations, which means you can either gradually migrate to Swift, or just start writing new apps with it instantly.
